subject: Ethics
title: Pandemic Ventilator Rationing
description: Learn Pandemic Ventilator Rationing in one minute.

hook.text: In 2020, Italian doctors chose which COVID patients got ventilators. Some criteria: age. Others: survival odds.

buildup.text: When ventilators ran out during COVID, hospitals faced an impossible question: who gets the machine?

discovery.text: Rationing protocols emerged using criteria like survival odds, life-years saved, and random lottery for ties.

twist.text: Using age as a criterion saves more 'life-years' but discriminates against the elderly. Both claims are true.

climax.text: No rationing system is fair to everyone. Every framework sacrifices one value to protect another.

punchline.text: When resources run out, every choice is a moral wound.

quiz.question: Why is using age as a ventilator rationing criterion ethically controversial?
options: It saves more 'life-years' but discriminates against elderly patients
Age has no correlation with survival outcomes
It is universally accepted as the fairest method
